verses.verse: The righteous<WH6662> perishes,<WH6> and no man<WH376> lays<WH7760> it to heart;<WH3820> and merciful<WH2617> men<WH582> are taken away,<WH622> none considering<WH995> that the righteous<WH6662> is taken away<WH622> from<WH6440> the evil.<WH7451>
He enters<WH935> into peace;<WH7965> they rest<WH5117> in their beds,<WH4904> each one who walks<WH1980> in his uprightness.<WH5228>
"But draw near<WH7126> here,<WH1121> you sons of the sorceress,<WH6049> the seed<WH2233> of the adulterer<WH5003> and the prostitute.<WH2181>

Against whom do you sport<WH6026> yourselves?<WH7337> Against whom do you make a wide mouth,<WH6310> and stick out<WH748> your tongue?<WH3956> Aren't<WH3206> you children of disobedience,<WH6588> a seed<WH2233> of falsehood,<WH8267>

you who inflame<WH2552> yourselves among the oaks,<WH410> under every green<WH7488> tree;<WH6086> who kill<WH7819> the children<WH3206> in the valleys,<WH5158> under the clefts<WH5585> of the rocks?<WH5553>

Among the smooth<WH2511> stones of the valley<WH5158> is your portion;<WH2506> they,<WH1486> they are your lot; you have even poured<WH8210> a drink offering<WH5262> to them.<WH5927> You have offered an offering.<WH4503> Shall I be appeased for these things?<WH5162>
On a high<WH5375> and lofty<WH1364> mountain<WH2022> you have set<WH7760> your bed;<WH4904> there also you went up<WH5927> to offer<WH2076> sacrifice.<WH2077>

Behind<WH310> the doors<WH1817> and the posts<WH4201> you have set up<WH7760> your memorial:<WH2146> for you have uncovered<WH1540> to someone besides me,<WH5927> and have gone up; you have enlarged<WH7337> your bed,<WH4904> and made<WH3772> you a covenant with them:<WH157> you loved their bed<WH4904> where<WH3027> you saw it.<WH2372>

You went<WH7788> to the king<WH4428> with oil,<WH8081> and increased<WH7235> your perfumes,<WH7547> and sent<WH7971> your ambassadors<WH6735> far off,<WH7350> and debased<WH8213> yourself even to Sheol.<WH7585>

You were wearied<WH3021> with the length<WH7230> of your way;<WH1870> yet you didn't<WH559> say, <WH2976> 'It is in vain.' You found<WH4672> a reviving<WH2416> of your strength;<WH3027> therefore you weren't<WH2470> faint.

"Of whom have you been afraid<WH1672> and in fear,<WH3372> that you lie,<WH3576> and have not remembered<WH2142> me,<WH7760> nor laid it to your heart?<WH3820> Haven't<WH2814> I held my peace even of long time,<WH5769> and you don't<WH3372> fear me?
I will declare<WH5046> your righteousness;<WH6666> and as for your works,<WH4639> they shall not profit you.<WH3276>

When you cry,<WH2199> let those who you have gathered deliver<WH5337> you;<WH7307> but the wind shall take<WH3947> them,<WH1892> a breath shall carry them all away:<WH5375> but he who takes<WH3947> refuge<WH2620> in me shall possess<WH5157> the land,<WH776> and shall inherit<WH3423> my holy<WH6944> mountain.<WH2022>"
He will say,<WH559> "Cast up,<WH5549> cast up,<WH5549> prepare<WH6437> the way,<WH1870> take up<WH7311> the stumbling-block<WH4383> out of the way<WH1870> of my people.<WH5971>"

For thus says<WH559> the high<WH7311> and lofty One<WH5375> who inhabits<WH7931> eternity,<WH5703> whose name<WH8034> is Holy:<WH6918> "I dwell<WH7931> in the high<WH4791> and holy<WH6918> place,<WH1793> with him also who is of a contrite and humble<WH8217> spirit,<WH7307> to revive<WH2421> the spirit<WH7307> of the humble,<WH8217> and to revive<WH2421> the heart<WH3820> of the contrite.<WH1792>

For I will not contend<WH7378> forever,<WH5769> neither will I be always<WH5331> angry;<WH7107> for the spirit<WH7307> would faint<WH5848> before<WH6440> me,<WH5397> and the souls who I have made.<WH6213>

For the iniquity<WH5771> of his covetousness<WH1215> was I angry,<WH7107> and struck<WH5221> him;<WH5641> I hid myself and was angry;<WH7107> and he went on<WH3212> backsliding<WH7726> in the way<WH1870> of his heart.<WH3820>
I have seen<WH7200> his ways,<WH1870> and will heal<WH7495> him:<WH5148> I will lead him also,<WH7999> and restore comforts<WH5150> to him and to his mourners.<WH57>

I create<WH1254> the fruit<WH5108> of the lips:<WH8193> Peace,<WH7965> peace,<WH7965> to him who is far off<WH7350> and to him who is near,<WH7138>" says<WH559> Yahweh;<WH3068> "and I will heal them.<WH7495>"
But the wicked<WH7563> are like the troubled<WH1644> sea;<WH3220> for it can't<WH3201> rest,<WH8252> and its waters<WH4325> cast up<WH1644> mire<WH7516> and dirt.<WH2916>
"There is no peace,<WH7965>" says<WH559> my God,<WH430> "for the wicked.<WH7563>"
